ul.li1: 141 The wisest of womenLiterally “wise ones of women” builds her house,
ul.li2: but the foolish tears it down with her hands.
ul.li1: 2He who walks in uprightness fears Yahweh,
ul.li2: but he who is devious in his ways displeases him.
ul.li1: 3In the mouth of a fool is the rod of pride,
ul.li2: but the lips of the wise preserve them.
ul.li1: 4When there are noLiterally “In there is no” oxen the manger is empty,
ul.li2: but an abundance of crops comes by the strength of an ox.Hebrew “bull”
ul.li1: 5A faithful witness does not lie,
ul.li2: but he who breathes out falsehood is a witness of deceit.
ul.li1: 6A scoffer seeks wisdom, but there is none,
ul.li2: but knowledge comes easily to him who understands.Literally “to one who understands it comes easy”
ul.li1: 7Leave the presence of a foolish man,Literally “from the presence belonging to a man of foolishness”
ul.li2: for you will not come to know words of knowledge.Literally “lips of knowledge”
ul.li1: 8The wisdom of the clever is understanding his ways,
ul.li2: but the folly of fools is deceit.
ul.li1: 9Fools mockHebrew “he mocks” the guilt offering,
ul.li2: but among the upright, it is favorable.
ul.li1: 10The heartOr “mind” knows the bitterness of its soul,Or “life,” or “inner self”
ul.li2: but in its joy, it will not share itself with a stranger.
ul.li1: 11The house of the wicked will be destroyed,
ul.li2: but the tent of the upright will flourish.
ul.li1: 12There is a way that seems upright toLiterally “to the face of” a man,
ul.li2: but its end is the way of death.
ul.li1: 13Even in laughter, a heart may be sad,
ul.li2: and the end of joy may be grief.
ul.li1: 14From his ways, the perverse of heart will be satisfied,
ul.li2: and from his own,Literally “from upon him” so shall a good man.
ul.li1: 15The simple will believe every word,
ul.li2: but the clever will consider his step.
ul.li1: 16The wise is cautious and turns from evil,
ul.li2: but the fool throws off restraint and is confident.
ul.li1: 17He who is short of temperLiterally “nostril” will act foolishly,
ul.li2: and the man who schemes will be hated.
ul.li1: 18The simple are adorned with folly,
ul.li2: but the clever are crowned with knowledge.
ul.li1: 19The evil bow down before the good,
ul.li2: and the wicked at the gates of the righteous.
ul.li1: 20The poor is disliked even by his neighbor,
ul.li2: but the lovers of the rich are many.
ul.li1: 21He who despises his neighbor is a sinner,
ul.li2: but he who has mercy on the poor blesses him.
ul.li1: 22Have they not erred, those who plan evil?
ul.li2: But loyalty and faithfulness belong to those who plan good.
ul.li1: 23In all toil, there is profit,
ul.li2: but the talkLiterally “word, matter, thing” of lips leads only to poverty.
ul.li1: 24The crown of the wise is their wealth;
ul.li2: the folly of fools is folly.
ul.li1: 25He who saves livesOr “souls,” or “inner selves” is a witness of truth,
ul.li2: but he who utters lies is a betrayer.
ul.li1: 26In the fear of Yahweh, there is confidence of strength,
ul.li2: and for his children, there will be refuge.
ul.li1: 27The fear of Yahweh is a fountain of life,
ul.li2: in order to turn from the snares of death.
ul.li1: 28In the multitude of people is the glory of the king,
ul.li2: but without a population, a prince is ruined.
ul.li1: 29He who is slow to anger has great understanding,
ul.li2: but the hasty of spiritOr “breath” exalts folly.
ul.li1: 30A heartOr “mind” of tranquilityOr “he who heals” is life to the flesh,
ul.li2: but causes bones of passion to rot.
ul.li1: 31He who oppresses the poor insults him who made him,
ul.li2: but he who has mercy on the poor honors him.
ul.li1: 32By his evildoing, the wicked will be overthrown,
ul.li2: and the righteous will find refuge in his death.
ul.li1: 33In the heartOr “mind” of him who has understanding, wisdom rests,
ul.li2: but even in the midst of fools it becomes known.
ul.li1: 34Righteousness will exalt a nation,
ul.li2: but sin is a reproach to a people.
ul.li1: 35The favor of a king is for the servant who deals wisely,
ul.li2: but his wrath will be on him who acts shamefully.
